The L* a* b* Ch° color coordinate data and band gap energies ( E g) for (Bi 1– x Ta
x ) 2O 3+2 x ( x = 0, 0.03, 0.04, and 0.20) and commercial orange Bayferrox 960 and Bayferrox 4960 pigments are summarized in Table 3 . The photographs of these pigments are also displayed in Figure 5 . It is obvious that both a* and b* values increased in a positive direction by the introduction of Ta 5+ in the host Bi 2O 3 lattice. Among them, the tetragonal (Bi 0.97Ta 0.03) 2O 3.06 sample strongly absorbed green and blue (complementary color of orange) lights and exhibited the most vivid orange color with the highest a* value.
